comment.author: 76016463@N00
comment._content: This looks like the Islip Kennel Club show, Sept. 4, 1915: Islip Dog Show To-day. The third annual dog show of the Islip Kennel Club will be held to-day at the Islip Polo Club grounds, Bay Shore, Long Island. More than 600 dogs have been entered in the various classes. Eighteen Old English sheepdogs will be exhibited, the largest number shown at any dog show this season. The Eng- lish and American foxhounds also will be well represented. There will be twelve dogs and twenty-two entries. (New York Tribune, 9/4/15) chroniclingamerica.loc.gov/lccn/sn83030214/1915-09-04/ed-... Here's a picture of Woolworth heiress Barbara Hutton, as a very young girl, at the same show: www.corbisimages.com/stock-photo/rights-managed/BE033499/... Looks like this is Tyler Morse, and Allon Fuller Black Morse, who were prominent in dog competitions. books.google.com/books?id=8TsSBPNBNBwC&lpg=PA230&.... She would die the next month of pneumonia.
